column4: hi guys, i ran an update recently, and after rebooting, all I'm getting is my wallpaper, no panel, icons, or anything...however all of the processes (i.e. gnome-panel) are running
press ALT+F2 and run nautilus
that brings up a filemanager, but doesnt restore my desktop icons
interestingly enough, if i run `killall gnome-panel' in a terminal, it appears to restart the process and then the panel shows up
kinda strange, its like the process loaded but forgot to display anything
hmm, usually nautilus draws the desktop
yea i know...for some reason the same trick doesnt work with nautilus
!panelfix | Patrinstar
!fixpanel | Patrinstar
heh
!panel
!resetpanel | Patrinstar
k, did that, i'll try logging out and back in
but i think there's more to it than that
since the desktop isnt showing either
oh sorry, i was wrong, i can get the desktop to draw if i restart nautilus
are the panels ok now though?
panels are fine, they just dont show up when i first login...
you could make a script to kill the panel then rerun them while you work out a fix
if you login as another user is it ok?
yea, the thought just crossed my mind, just not a very elegant solution
